ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I feel happier or more cheerful than usual
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Occasionally; 2=Often; 3=Most of the time; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: I feel more self confident than usual
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Occasionally; 2=Often; 3=Most of the time; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: I need less sleep than usual
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Occasionally; 2=Often; 3=Most of the time; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: I talk more than usual
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Occasionally; 2=Often; 3=Most of the time; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: I have been more active than usual
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=Occasionally; 2=Often; 3=Most of the time; 4=All the time

ElementDescription: ASRM score
Subject related information (e.g the affection, phenotype, disease information, etc.).
Site
Study; The code for each individual study
Week in level/study
Days since baseline
Visit type
Visit name
Timepoint/visit label
Study Phase
Notes: 1=Phase 1: Treatment as Usual(TAU); 2=Phase 2: Screening Only; 3=Phase 3: Intervention; 4=Focus Groups; 5=Open Trial; 6=Randomized Trial; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Treatment condition
Level 2 - Adult - Mania Prorated raw score
Level 2 - Adult - Mania interpretation
I feel happier or more cheerful than usual
Notes: 1= I do not feel happier or more cheerful than usual; 2= I occasionally feel happier or more cheerful than usual; 3= I often feel happier or more cheerful than usual; 4= I feel happier or more cheerful than usual most of the time; 5= I feel happier of more cheerful than usual all of the time

ElementDescription: I feel more self confident than usual
Notes: 1= I do not feel more self-confident than usual; 2= I occasionally feel more self-confident than usual; 3= I often feel more self-confident than usual; 4= I frequently feel more self-confident than usual; 5= I feel extremely self-confident all of the time

ElementDescription: I need less sleep than usual
Notes: 1= I do not need less sleep than usual; 2= I occasionally need less sleep than usual; 3= I often need less sleep than usual; 4= I frequently need less sleep than usual; 5= I can go all day and all night without any sleep and still not feel tired

ElementDescription: I talk more than usual
Notes: 1= I do not talk more than usual; 2= I occasionally talk more than usual; 3= I often talk more than usual; 4= I frequently talk more than usual; 5= I talk constantly and cannot be interrupted

ElementDescription: I have been more active than usual
Notes: 1= I have not been more active (either socially, sexually, at work, home, or school) than usual; 2= I have occasionally been more active than usual; 3= I have often been more active than usual; 4= I have frequently been more active than usual; 5= I am constantly more active or on the go all the time
